{{scene | name = Return to Edoras | film = [[The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King]] | image = The Lord of the Rings - The Return of the King - Gandalf and Aragorn at Edoras.png | number = 4 (theatrical)
5 (extended) | duration = | event = | characters = [[Aragorn]], [[Gandalf]], [[Éowyn]], [[Théoden]], [[Legolas]], [[Gimli]], [[Éomer]], [[Meriadoc Brandybuck|Merry]], [[Peregrin Took|Pippin]] | previous = [[The Voice of Saruman (scene)|The Voice of Saruman]] | next = [[Gollum's Villainy]] }} '''Return to Edoras''' is the fourth scene of ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King]]'' and the fifth scene of [[The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King (extended edition)|''The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King'' (extended edition)]]. It was extended in the latter edition. == Synopsis == [[Gandalf]] and the company from [[Orthanc]] return to the [[Golden Hall]] to take rest and honour those who died for victory at the [[Battle of Helm's Deep]]. During the feasting, [[Théoden]] speaks with [[Éowyn]], telling her that he is happy for Éowyn's love for [[Aragorn]], and that Aragorn was largely responsible for victory at [[Helm's Deep]]. [[Legolas]] and [[Gimli]] take part in a drinking game with [[Éomer]] watching and serving drinks. Gimli becomes quite clearly intoxicated very quickly and passes out, while Legolas merely feels ''"a slight tingle"'' in his fingers. [[Meriadoc Brandybuck|Merry]] and [[Peregrin Took|Pippin]] dance to music on a table to the delight of a large crowd. Aragorn discusses [[Frodo Baggins|Frodo]] with Gandalf, saying that he moves closer to [[Mordor]] every day. Gandalf questions how they can know that for sure, and, in reply, Aragorn asks Gandalf, ''"what does you heart tell you?"'' [[Category:The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King scenes|05]]
